meanings.definition: Continuing for a long time or longer than usual.
meanings.sent1: The prolonged movie made me sleepy.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's prolonged explanation was hard to follow.
meanings.sent3: The prolonged wait for the bus felt like forever.
meanings.sent4: Her prolonged absence left us worried.

meanings.definition: To lengthen in time; extend the duration of.
meanings.sent1: I decided to prolong my vacation by a few days.
meanings.sent2: The doctor suggested prolonging the treatment for better results.
meanings.sent3: He tried to prolong the meeting by asking irrelevant questions.
meanings.sent4: The chef wanted to prolong the cooking time for a richer flavor.
meanings.sent5: The gardener needed to prolong the watering to revive the plants.
